template.name: Template Net Mikrotik SNMPv2
template.description:
Template Net Mikrotik
MIBs used: HOST-RESOURCES-MIB MIKROTIK-MIB
Known Issues:
Description: Doesn't have ifHighSpeed filled. fixed in more recent versions Version: RouterOS 6.28 or lower
Description: Doesn't have any temperature sensors Version: RouterOS 6.38.5 Device: Mikrotik 941-2nD, Mikrotik 951G-2HnD
Template tooling version used: 0.33

item.name: Used memory
item.description: MIB: HOST-RESOURCES-MIB The amount of the storage represented by this entry that is allocated, in units of hrStorageAllocationUnits.

item.name: Total memory
item.description: MIB: HOST-RESOURCES-MIB The size of the storage represented by this entry, in units of hrStorageAllocationUnits. This object is writable to allow remote configuration of the size of the storage area in those cases where such an operation makes sense and is possible on the underlying system. For example, the amount of main memory allocated to a buffer pool might be modified or the amount of disk space allocated to virtual memory might be modified.

item.name: Device: Temperature
item.description: MIB: MIKROTIK-MIB (mtxrHlTemperature) Device temperature in Celsius (degrees C). Might be missing in entry models (RB750, RB450G..) Reference: http://wiki.mikrotik.com/wiki/Manual:SNMP

item_prototype.name: #{#SNMPINDEX}: CPU utilization
item_prototype.description: MIB: HOST-RESOURCES-MIB The average, over the last minute, of the percentage of time that this processor was not idle. Implementations may approximate this one minute smoothing period if necessary.

trigger_prototype.name: #{#SNMPINDEX}: High CPU utilization (over {$CPU.UTIL.CRIT}% for 5m)
trigger_prototype.description: Current utilization: {ITEM.LASTVALUE1} CPU utilization is too high. The system might be slow to respond.

discovery_rule.name: Temperature CPU discovery
discovery_rule.description: MIKROTIK-MIB::mtxrHlProcessorTemperature Since temperature of CPU is not available on all Mikrotik hardware, this is done to avoid unsupported items.

item_prototype.name: CPU: Temperature
item_prototype.description: MIB: MIKROTIK-MIB (mtxrHlProcessorTemperature) Processor temperature in Celsius (degrees C). Might be missing in entry models (RB750, RB450G..)

trigger_prototype.name: CPU: Temperature is above warning threshold: >{$TEMP_WARN:"CPU"}
trigger_prototype.description: Current value: {ITEM.LASTVALUE1} This trigger uses temperature sensor values as well as temperature sensor status if available

dependency.name: CPU: Temperature is above critical threshold: >{$TEMP_CRIT:"CPU"}

trigger_prototype.name: CPU: Temperature is above critical threshold: >{$TEMP_CRIT:"CPU"}
trigger_prototype.description: Current value: {ITEM.LASTVALUE1} This trigger uses temperature sensor values as well as temperature sensor status if available

item_prototype.name: Disk-{#SNMPINDEX}: Used space
item_prototype.description: MIB: HOST-RESOURCES-MIB The amount of the storage represented by this entry that is allocated, in units of hrStorageAllocationUnits.

item_prototype.name: Disk-{#SNMPINDEX}: Total space
item_prototype.description: MIB: HOST-RESOURCES-MIB The size of the storage represented by this entry, in units of hrStorageAllocationUnits. This object is writable to allow remote configuration of the size of the storage area in those cases where such an operation makes sense and is possible on the underlying system. For example, the amount of main memory allocated to a buffer pool might be modified or the amount of disk space allocated to virtual memory might be modified.

trigger_prototype.expression: {Template Net Mikrotik SNMPv2:vfs.fs.pused[hrStorageSize.{#SNMPINDEX}].last()}>{$VFS.FS.PUSED.MAX.CRIT:"Disk-{#SNMPINDEX}"} and (({Template Net Mikrotik SNMPv2:vfs.fs.total[hrStorageSize.{#SNMPINDEX}].last()}-{Template Net Mikrotik SNMPv2:vfs.fs.used[hrStorageSize.{#SNMPINDEX}].last()})<5G or {Template Net Mikrotik SNMPv2:vfs.fs.pused[hrStorageSize.{#SNMPINDEX}].timeleft(1h,,100)}<1d)
trigger_prototype.name: Disk-{#SNMPINDEX}: Disk space is critically low (used > {$VFS.FS.PUSED.MAX.CRIT:"Disk-{#SNMPINDEX}"}%)
trigger_prototype.description: Space used: {ITEM.LASTVALUE3} of {ITEM.LASTVALUE2} ({ITEM.LASTVALUE1}) Two conditions should match: First, space utilization should be above {$VFS.FS.PUSED.MAX.CRIT:"Disk-{#SNMPINDEX}"}. Second condition should be one of the following: - The disk free space is less than 5G. - The disk will be full in less than 24 hours.

trigger_prototype.expression: {Template Net Mikrotik SNMPv2:vfs.fs.pused[hrStorageSize.{#SNMPINDEX}].last()}>{$VFS.FS.PUSED.MAX.WARN:"Disk-{#SNMPINDEX}"} and (({Template Net Mikrotik SNMPv2:vfs.fs.total[hrStorageSize.{#SNMPINDEX}].last()}-{Template Net Mikrotik SNMPv2:vfs.fs.used[hrStorageSize.{#SNMPINDEX}].last()})<10G or {Template Net Mikrotik SNMPv2:vfs.fs.pused[hrStorageSize.{#SNMPINDEX}].timeleft(1h,,100)}<1d)
trigger_prototype.name: Disk-{#SNMPINDEX}: Disk space is low (used > {$VFS.FS.PUSED.MAX.WARN:"Disk-{#SNMPINDEX}"}%)
trigger_prototype.description: Space used: {ITEM.LASTVALUE3} of {ITEM.LASTVALUE2} ({ITEM.LASTVALUE1}) Two conditions should match: First, space utilization should be above {$VFS.FS.PUSED.MAX.WARN:"Disk-{#SNMPINDEX}"}. Second condition should be one of the following: - The disk free space is less than 10G. - The disk will be full in less than 24 hours.

dependency.name: Disk-{#SNMPINDEX}: Disk space is critically low (used > {$VFS.FS.PUSED.MAX.CRIT:"Disk-{#SNMPINDEX}"}%)
dependency.expression: {Template Net Mikrotik SNMPv2:vfs.fs.pused[hrStorageSize.{#SNMPINDEX}].last()}>{$VFS.FS.PUSED.MAX.CRIT:"Disk-{#SNMPINDEX}"} and (({Template Net Mikrotik SNMPv2:vfs.fs.total[hrStorageSize.{#SNMPINDEX}].last()}-{Template Net Mikrotik SNMPv2:vfs.fs.used[hrStorageSize.{#SNMPINDEX}].last()})<5G or {Template Net Mikrotik SNMPv2:vfs.fs.pused[hrStorageSize.{#SNMPINDEX}].timeleft(1h,,100)}<1d)

trigger.name: High memory utilization ( >{$MEMORY.UTIL.MAX}% for 5m)
trigger.description: Last value: {ITEM.LASTVALUE1} The system is running out of free memory.

trigger.name: Device: Temperature is above warning threshold: >{$TEMP_WARN:"Device"}
trigger.description: Current value: {ITEM.LASTVALUE1} This trigger uses temperature sensor values as well as temperature sensor status if available

dependency.name: Device: Temperature is above critical threshold: >{$TEMP_CRIT:"Device"}

trigger.name: Device: Temperature is above critical threshold: >{$TEMP_CRIT:"Device"}
trigger.description: Current value: {ITEM.LASTVALUE1} This trigger uses temperature sensor values as well as temperature sensor status if available

trigger.name: Operating system description has changed
trigger.description: Last value: {ITEM.LASTVALUE1} Operating system description has changed. Possible reasons that system has been updated or replaced. Ack to close.

trigger.expression: {Template Net Mikrotik SNMPv2:system.hw.serialnumber.diff()}=1 and {Template Net Mikrotik SNMPv2:system.hw.serialnumber.strlen()}>0
trigger.name: Device has been replaced (new serial number received)
trigger.description: Last value: {ITEM.LASTVALUE1} Device serial number has changed. Ack to close

trigger.expression: {Template Net Mikrotik SNMPv2:system.hw.firmware.diff()}=1 and {Template Net Mikrotik SNMPv2:system.hw.firmware.strlen()}>0
trigger.name: Firmware has changed
trigger.description: Current value: {ITEM.LASTVALUE1} Firmware version has changed. Ack to close
